Spells.Spell Modification:
Spell Modification

Mana Strain

Take 1 Exhaustion to reduce MP cost by one tier (Tier I = 0 MP). Repeatable up to Exhaustion max.

Rushed Spells (Beam, Explosion, Curing, Restoration)

Cast as Bonus Action. Damage/healing reduced by ½ (min 1).

Overcharging (Beam, Explosion, Curing, Restoration)

Gain 2 Exhaustion for bonus dice:
  • Beam: +Rep Level d8s
  • Explosion: +½ Rep Level d10s (not affected by Intensity)
  • Curing: +Rep Level d6s
  • Restoration: +Rep Level d4s

Total Focus

Required for some spells. Only one effect at a time. Lost when: Berserk, Depleted, Drained, Exposed, Horrified, Silenced, Soul-Siphoned, Soul-Tainted, Unconscious, or combat ends.

Quickening (Barrier, Summoning)

Increase MP cost by 1 Tier to change Action type. No Spell Intensity Tax.

Spells.Release Magic Style:
Release Magic Style

Release is a unique Magic Style that uses a Spell Deck instead of traditional Spell Paths. Selecting Release entirely replaces your ability to choose other Spell Paths.

Core Rules

  • Collector's Spell Deck: Required Magical Implement to cast Release spells
  • Drawing Spell Cards: At Combat start, draw cards = 3 + Reputation Level (min 1). This is also your Hand Limit
  • Release Power: Standard Action to play a Spell Card. Discard face-up after use
  • Scaling Value: All cards have Scaling Value +X (see table). Stress Points penalize Scaling when Endurance Die fails
  • Fate Die: Some cards require 1d20 roll. No abilities/modifiers affect Fate Die results
  • Draw a Card: At turn end, draw 1 card. Bonus Action: Draw additional card if below Hand Limit

    • Special Abilities

  • Signature Card (Levels 5, 10): Instead of Swift Attack, choose one card from deck. Begin every encounter with it in hand. Cannot choose Love Card
  • Discharge Energy: Bonus Action, discard top card for 30ft Weapon Attack (1d20 + DEX + Proficiency). Deals 1d6 + MAM Magical. At Level 5: +1d8. At Level 10: double MAM
  • Explosive Trinity: Full-Round, discard 3 matching Triumvirate or 3 Court Cards. Make 3 Magic Attacks (1d20 + MAM + Proficiency), 30ft, 3d6 + MAM each. Damage increases: 3d8 (5th), 3d10 (10th), 3d12 (15th)
  • Cycling the Spell Deck: When deck empty, gain 2 Stress to shuffle discard pile into new deck

Deathwatch

Spells with Deathwatch can be cast as Bonus Action or Reaction when adjacent ally reaches 0 HP. Does not prevent initial Crystalline Fracture.

Spells.Temporal Huntress:
Temporal Huntress

When a Chronomancer casts Tier V or VI Chronomancy spells, they risk summoning a Temporal Huntress—a time-traveling assassin sent by the Invading Evil to hunt Chronomancers.

Summoning Trigger

SpellRollTrigger
Time Displaced Weapon (Tier V)1d10090+ summons Temporal Huntress
Chrono Dance (Tier VI)1d10080+ summons Temporal Huntress

Temporal Huntress Template

When summoned, the Magic Keeper places a Spectral Outsider matching the squadron's Invasion Level (Adversary Rank). The recommended first Temporal Huntress is a Shrieking Canticula. The chosen Outsider gains this template:

Template Additions:

  • Gains Clearsight
  • Roll Initiative with Advantage. Appears during its turn and makes an immediate Ambush Attack against the Chronomancer
  • Chronomancy Resistance: Damage from Chronomancy spells reduced by ½
  • Advantage on Rolls to Resist vs Chronomancy effects
  • Damage dealt by Temporal Huntress cannot be mitigated by Chronomancy magic
  • When Chronomancy teleportation is used, may immediately Teleport 15ft
  • All Move Actions count as Teleportation
  • Gains Predator (Chronomancers) and Cruel and Hateful (Chronomancers) traits

    • Behavior:

  • If all nearby Chronomancers are slain: Full-Round Action to teleport 300ft and leave Encounter
  • If slain: Add 1d8 to Inert Spectral Energy total. No new Temporal Huntress for rest of Episode

    • Limits:

  • Only one Temporal Huntress pursues each Chronomancer per Episode
  • Magic Keeper may introduce one at any point after a Tier V+ Chronomancy spell has been cast
